Description.Name: Mirror, Mirror
Description.Details: [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] crosses through the docking hatch to board the Moirai, stopping at the closed hatchway to proceed further into the ship. The hatch behind {SCN_MW.OBJ} closes, and a gas billows out from the overhead vent. {SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} tries to cover {SCN_MW.DET} face, but {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:are|Default:is} soon rendered unconscious. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: Darius knocks at the open doorway to your office, then enters, "Commander, there is an incoming priority message from Front Man." You look up, "Patch it through, Darius." Darius punches in some information on the terminal next to the large display screen mounted on the wall in your office, "Transmission coming in now, Commander." The black screen shimmers to life, the blurry images slowly taking focus. The image resolves into a view of [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], slumped in a chair. You and Darius are glued to the screen watching the events unfold: ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] awakens and discovers that {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:are|Default:is} chained to a desk in front of a mirror that fills the wall. One hand is secured to the chair, the other is extended and secured to the desk. Within reach of {SCN_MW.Det} fingers are four buttons with a different symbol on each: CIRCLE, SQUARE, TRIANGLE, STAR. Also mounted on the desk, pointed directly at the mirror is a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBlazerLaserPistol], Blazer Laser Pistol]], which is wired to a panel above the buttons. The comms panel activates, and a digitized voice speaks, "Welcome Player 203. The game you are about to play is called Mirror, Mirror. The rules of the game are simple. You are pitted against your opponent, seated on the opposite side of the mirror in front of you. When the game starts, the buttons will be active and you must press one of the four buttons before your opponent presses theirs. The winner is the player who can press the correct button, the fastest." [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] tries to move {SCN_MW.DET} head to look around, but it is strapped to the high back of the chair. {SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} can only use {SCN_MW.DET} eyes to scan the small room, which is empty of anything else. The comms activate, "The game will begin in 3... 2... 1... " ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::SIGNAL LOST:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: Back on the Argo, you jump out of your chair yelling, "NO! Darius, get that connection re-established now!" Darius is frantically typing into the terminal, "Working on it Commander!" ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] reaches {SCN_MW.DET} fingers forward and decides to...

Description.Name: WE HAVE A WINNER!
Description.Details: Darius pumps his hand in the air, "YES! I got it Commander." The image flares back to life and focuses in on [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] quickly presses the button with CIRCLE symbol on it. The laser next to {SCN_MW.OBJ} hums and fires a steady beam directly at the mirror. The mirror glows at the impact point and the edges blacken, then punches through the thick glass before shutting down. An acrid smell fills the small room, the lights dim and the mirror fades to clear glass, showing another player in the same situation as [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]. The difference being that Player 187 now has a hole burned into their chest and they are quite dead. The comms activate again, "Player 187, eliminated. Player 203 wins this round." ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: You and Darius shout out in unison, "{SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} did it!" Barely able to contain the smiles on your faces, you both watch the events continuing to unfold on the screen. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: The door behind [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] opens and two armed and fully masked guards enter. They remove the straps and pull [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] to {SCN_MW.DET} feet. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] looks at one of the guards, "Where are you taking me? I do not want to do this anymore." The guards ignore {SCN_MW.DET} pleas and escort {SCN_MW.OBJ} out of the room. They move through the corridors, with numerous twists and turns, passing many closed doorways along the route. Eventually, they stop in front of a door with the numbers 203 painted on it. The door opens and they motion [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] to enter. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] looks at them, then their weapons, and reluctantly enters the room. The room, is more of a small cubicle, with no windows, only one door, a bed, basin, mirror and toilet. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] slumps on the bed and mutters, "I guess this is where I will be staying until this is over... or I die." The voice sounds over the comms, "All players, the next round will begin tomorrow. Lights out in 15 minutes." ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: The screen fades out, and is replaced with a SIGNAL TERMINATED notice. Darius looks at you, "Commander, it appears that these games are purely chance, with almost no skill involved. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s chances are not looking that good." You drop into your chair, exhausted from the elation that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] is still alive, but fearful that {SCN_MW.DET} situation can change in the blink of an eye. You look up at Darius, "Let the crew know that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] has successfully passed {SCN_MW.DET} first trial." Hopefully, the remaining trials will be just as successful.

Description.Name: GAME OVER
Description.Details: Darius pumps his hand in the air, "YES! I got it Commander." The image flares back to life and focuses in on [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] quickly presses the button with CIRCLE symbol on it. A low humming noise can be heard, but it is not coming from the laser next to {SCN_MW.OBJ}. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] looks at the laser, then starts mashing all the other buttons with no effect. A small point on the mirror begins to glow and the edges around the glow blacken, then a ruby beam of light bursts forth striking [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] directly in the chest. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s head jerks back, pain etched across {SCN_MW.OBJ} face, before {SCN_MW.OBJ} eyes flutter and close, head slumping forward. The mirror fades to clear glass, showing another player in the same situation as [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]. The difference being that Player 187 has a shocked look on their face, which changes to relief in knowing that they are not dead. The comms activate again, "Player 203, eliminated. Player 187 wins this round." ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: You stare in disbelief at the screen, mouth open. Darius' shout breaks your trance, "Noooo!" Barely able to control your emotions, you both watch the events continuing to unfold on the screen. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: The door behind [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] opens and two armed and fully masked guards enter pushing a trolly. They remove the straps and place [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s body onto the trolly and wheel him out of the room. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: The screen fades out, and is replaced with a SIGNAL TERMINATED notice. A PING alert sounds on the comm panel at your desk. You move over to it and see an automated text message. It appears to be from Front Man. You click OPEN to read the message: My condolences, Commander {Commander.Lastname}. Since you are reading this message, it means that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] did not survive ROUND 1 of the game. Know that {SCN_MW.DET} debt is now paid in full, and there will be no further reparations needed on {SCN_MW.DET} behalf. In fact, we will be giving you and your crew, a consolation prize. When [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] left on our dropship, we left behind a crate. You will find it magnetically attached to your hull outside the docking collar we used to pick up [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]. It is a shame the game did not go the full term, we could have made so much more money and your prize would have been that much greater. Regards, Front Man You look up from the screen and Darius looks at you, "Commander, it appears that these games were purely chance, with almost no skill involved. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s chances of surviving were not that good, I think." You lean back in your chair, exhausted from the watching the ordeal that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] went through, "Advise the crew, they need to know that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] is not returning to us. We need to get past this and get on with our jobs." As Darius leaves, you cannot help but wonder if your path will cross Front Man's again.
